representation_information.name: AMR, Adaptive Multi-Rate Speech Codec
representation_information.description: Audio data compression scheme optimized for speech coding, adopted in October 1998 as the standard speech codec by 3GPP (3d Generation Partnership Project) and now widely used in GSM (Global System for Mobile Communications). The AMR bit rates of 12.2, 10.2, 7.95, 7.40, 6.70, 5.90, 5.15 and 4.75 kb/s are based on frames that contain 160 samples and are 20 milliseconds long.

relation.title: Sustainability of Digital Formats: Planning for Library of Congress Collections
